poem:
Resignation  

John's hands, like leaves,  
folded over headlines,  
release their grip from ink—  
the weight of networks gone.  
In the hum of city rhythms,  
editorial strings fray,  
a sudden autumn whisper:  
all things move,  
shift,  
settle—  
and newsprint drifts between  
the sidewalk cracks.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "CBS News anchor John Dickerson becomes latest figure to exit network John Dickerson, a longtime CBS News journalist, has become the latest high-profile figure to resign from the network amid concerns about its ownership and ability to maintain editorial independence. Dickerson, who over 16 years at the news organization has served in a variety of roles, including moderator of Face the Nation and chief political analyst, announced on Instagram that he would leave at the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
